data.title: Find command doesn't work in debug panel
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Debug panel lacks ability to search for text. I expected cmd-F to work.

data.title: UX improvements for automated typings acquisition
data.body: Adopt new status code API to improve automatic typing acquisition UX

data.title: Improve large project warning for Js/Ts projects
data.body: VSCode currently generates a warning for js/ts projects that contain more than a certain number of files. We'd like to coordinate with the TS team to get the TS server to generate a warning message for these large projects instead.

data.title: Intellisense not working - tsserver saying "LanguageService is disabled"

- VSCode Version: 1.7.1#02611b, and 1.8.0-insider#a3e85d
- OS Version: Windows 10

After starting VS code & typing something, this is the log

[Info  - 3:03:30 PM] Using tsserver from location: d:\Users\{User}\code\AppRoot\node_modules\typescript\lib\tsserver.js

data.title: Remove jsconfig.json light bulb
data.body: Remove the hint about creating a that displays in JavaScript projects without a `jsconfig.json` file present. I believe that TypeScript will now infer projects if no `jsconfig.json` file is found.

data.title: Dynamically adding properties to an object doesn't show up in suggestions.
data.body:
IntelliSense struggles on objects that get their properties after they are declared.

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4624233/20114045/c8288284-a5a7-11e6-8ab6-d6b1402c3ed7.png)
In this example I'd like to see charAt, indexOf, etc.

This problem was mentioned in #1685

data.title: JS syntax variable highlighting only affecting some variables
data.body:
- VSCode Version: e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55
- OS Version: OS X El Cap 10.11.6

When chaining variable assignments together, only the first variable name is colored:

![syntax highlighting screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/829827/20113804/e834f9fa-a5bf-11e6-878d-5fd5b082ae7e.png)

This is using the Dark+ theme, but I didn't see any theme in the default set that colors all three of the variable names.

Apologies if there's a different repo this belongs on.

Thanks!

data.title: Port language server implementation to TS 2.0
Copy (cmd+C) in panel removes selection after copy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select text in a panel (e.g. terminal)
2. cmd+C.
3. Text is copied, but selection disappears.

This is surprising and inconsistent with every UI widget ever made.

data.title: Zooming causes strange behavior for Extension READMEs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 - Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click Extension activity bar button
2. Click an extension
3. Zoom in

I expect to be able to see the entire README. 

Instead I see only a portion of the README with scroll bar positions far in towards the center. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/20112667/1ce5be5a-a5a2-11e6-9da9-a6f723ad8bec.png)

> Note: I have searched for this issue but have not been able to find it in our repo.

data.title: Update to VSCode-Textmate 2.3.1
data.body:
This bumps the vscode-textmate version to pick up this work: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-textmate/pull/30

Taking in this change allows us to take in fixes such as #14626, and also addresses some existing edge cases in the markdown grammar

data.title: Changing Tab Endentation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|riot-tag|crisward|0.1.7|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|0.1.0|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.1|
|view-in-browser|qinjia|0.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open A file with JavaScript
2. Edit some code.
3. Hit command Save

I have my user and workspace preferences set to use tabs as two spaces. When I save a JavaScript file after editing, Code changes the tabs to four spaces for the entire document. When I correct the tab spacing and save, Code again converts the tabs back to four spaces. This takes several tries before Code finally accepts the document as is, and then it start again after the next edit and save. Very frustrating. It looks like Code 1.7.1 is not respecting tab size in user and workspace preferences.

data.title: HTML tag not paired in PHP files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7
- OS Version: Win 10 64

Hello, I work a lot in PHP and one feature that will boost a lot productivity is the possibility to "pair" the HTML tags in PHP files as normally done in HTML files (please refer to the attached image for visual explanation). 
I know that it is possible to switch between PHP and HTML languages using the button on the bottom right part of the page. I was just wondering if it is possible to have an automatic recognition of HTML tags in mixed HTML / PHP content (like other editors do) without the need to switch forth and back between languages.

Thanks
![paired-tags](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16580030/20109581/fe2296de-a5e0-11e6-9aad-d45d32f54214.png)

data.title: How to add buttons in sidebar
data.body:
It may be a feature request or a kinda of help, I wanted to know how can I add buttons at the sidebar. The closer feature request to this can be found in here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15017 . However, I'm interested about a oficial way to create new buttons and call our own custom methods, rather than  the creation of default sidebar functionality   to allow processes control. In the matter of fact by constructing this official callable buttons from the sidebar, we will be capable of creating the functionality which egamma asked for.

I looked for this feature on the Git's Issues, and at the VS Code repository, and I found nothing. However, if you did found something about it, please post in here a link for us.  



Thank you.

When I tried to print Chinese on the externalConsole , it just showed me the garbled message:

```
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");
Console.WriteLine("");
```

but when I tried to print the same text on the debug console, it showed just as expected!
I cannot fix the problem by myself, and I need help!

data.title: Ability to publish prerelease build streams of extensions and opt-in

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- Feature Request
I'd like to be able to publish a prerelease stream of my extension without publishing an entirely separate extension with a different ID. Would be ideal to have this be accessible to opt into in the extensions panel.

Thanks!

data.title: Opening VSCode from cmd/PowerShell binds it to that terminal's lifespan
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open cmd.exe or PowerShell (user or admin mode)
2. Execute `code` (with or without parameters)
3. Once VSCode opens, close the terminal
4. VSCode will also close

Explicitly disconnecting the child process spawned from `bin/code.js` with `child.unref()` doesn't appear to resolve the issue, so it may not be tied to the Node.js initialization code.

data.title: settings.json reverted and now contains superfluous comma after updating to 1.7.1

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

I was prompted to update VS Code, did the update and when it finished and re-opened Code none of my previous settings carried over. The Explorer side-bar was moved back to the left side (previously had it on the right), custom font type and size were reverted to defaults, etc.

I went to View > Move sidebar right and received the error:

Unable to write settings, Please open User Settings to correct errors/warnings in the file and try again.

I went to File > Preferences > User Settings and two settings.json files open, one for Default settings and one for User settings. One error shows in the error window for the user settings.json file:

"Property expected (5, 1)"

the settings.json file looks like this:

```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    	// Controls the font size.
	"editor.fontSize": 18,
}
```

I was able to fix the issue by removing the comma from the end of line 4, but this should not have been there after the update anyway.

data.title: Request textDocument/documentLink failed with message: Path must be a string. Received undefined
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.7.1
- OS Version:  Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.   Open any HTML file that wasn't produced by VSC
2.   Error displays.

Error:
> [Error - 10:14:18 AM] Request textDocument/documentLink failed.
>   Message: Request textDocument/documentLink failed with message: Path must be a string. Received undefined
>   Code: -32603 

Notes: 
Wrote a simple HTML file that included Javascript code and CSS code in VSC, got no error.  Saved it, closed VSC, and opened a new VSC session with all extensions enabled, then opened that same file I created earlier, no error.  So it appears it only occurs with files that was not created by VSC. 

Ran VSC via terminal `code --disable-extensions` and tried opening file that was not created by VSC, same error.  So it's definitely not an extension. 

I've included screenshot of error.

![screenshot_20161108_101743](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2024899/20107001/a1894650-a59c-11e6-8baa-2d689d3da773.png)
